Resolved Question Show me another » Why is it whenever i order a milk shake at a fast food restaurant the always make the milkshake first? Has anyone else ever noticed that? It sits there on the counter melting while my food is being cooked. Think about it. Don't most people generally eat their milk shake during the time they are eating their food or take it home and freeze it for later. By the time my hot food is ready it's always halfway melted. Why do all fast food restaurant do it that way? When someone orders their meal that is always the last thing to be ordered. It shouldn't be the first thing prepared. I have even tried ordering my milk shake on a separate order to avoid my milk shake from melting and still they made it first before my food was ready. 4 years ago Report Abuse by Effem T Member since: 17 May 2008 Total points: 6,627 (Level 5) Add Contact Block
Best Answer - Chosen by Asker It's a conspiracy. They hate you. 4 years ago Report Abuse

3 people rated this as good by rachel7 Member since: 27 September 2008 Total points: 311 (Level 2) Add Contact Block I used to work at dq and this is how it worked there: we had a staff that worked at the front--taking orders and making all drinks, blizzards, and shakes, and we had a staff that worked the back making all the hot food. We always worked a little faster in the front than in the back, so that is why the shakes always are done first. The back takes a little longer for everything to cook. They were two seperate operations, making hot food and making drinks and such. Source(s): personal experience 4 years ago Report Abuse
